did.abstract: The Hegeman family photographs consist of 27 black-and-white photographic prints, dating from 1899, documenting the Hegeman family of Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Hegeman family photographs consist of 27 black-and-white photographic prints, dating from 1899, documenting the Hegeman family of Brooklyn. Included are group portraits of members of the Hegeman family aboard the SS St. Louis in April of 1899; informal portraits and group portraits of family members inside or outside family homes; exterior views of rowhouses in the Park Slope neighborhood of Brooklyn; interior and exterior views of a home located at 250 6th Avenue in Park Slope; an interior view of a home located at 440 3rd Street in Park Slope; street views showing large homes in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn; an interior view of a business located at 297 Broadway; and photographs taken in or near Prospect Park including views of Grand Army Plaza, park bridges, and members of the Hegeman family in Prospect Park.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for anonymously created items remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. Based on the date this collection, the photographs will enter the public domain in 2019. relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For more genealogical information pertaining to the Hegeman family, see the Henry Onderdonk papers (ARC.045). Brooklyn Historical Society (BHS) also holds:
1. Thomas Hegeman New Utrecht, New York Justice of the Peace papers (1973.127)

The Othmer Library at BHS holds the related title by Helen Miller: Old Brooklyn Families: Genealogies of the Hegeman, Holgersen, Joosten, Nagel, Polhemius, Rapalje, Remsen, Stryker, Vanderbilt, and Van Wyck families. Santa Barbara, Calif.: s.n., 1986. (Main Collection CS69 .O45 1986 / Non-circulating)
